docs.lead_paragraph: The sidewalk cafe -- that seasonal fixture suggesting summer in the city, leisurely lunches, Paris on the Hudson -- could become even more visible in New York's streetscape under a Bloomberg administration plan. Taking restaurant diners, literally, to the streets, cafes have been hugging sidewalks from Madison Avenue on the Upper East Side to DeKalb Avenue in Brooklyn, and now city officials are working on a way for more of them to become legitimate.

headline.main: More Cafes May Sprout on Sidewalks

docs.abstract: Sidewalk cafe--seasonal fixture suggesting summer in city--could become even more visible in New York's streetscape under Bloomberg administration plan; city officials are working on way to ease permit process for sidewalk cafes; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Menopause is not a disease, as doctors often point out, only an inevitability of middle age. But for most women, it does come with symptoms, as the body is weaned from its customary diet of estrogen. Some of these can be more than a little annoying: sudden spikes in temperature that make the face flush and the sweat flow; soaked sheets at 3 a.m.; vaginal dryness that causes incessant pain and itching. An estimated 20 million American women have been treating these problems and also trying to preserve the strength of their bones and hearts by taking daily doses of estrogen to replace what their ovaries no longer provide. But then came last week's announcement that hormone replacement therapy caused small but significant increases in breast cancer, heart attack, stroke and blood clots in a nationwide study of postmenopausal women. And now many women are wondering if they may want to try something else.

headline.main: Hormone Therapy: One Size, Clearly, No Longer Fits All

docs.abstract: Article on issues estimated 20 million American women may have to consider following announcement that hormone replacement therapy has caused small but significant increases in breast cancer, heart attacks, strokes and blood clots in nationwide study of postmenopausal women; chart; photo (M)
